result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor Jon Bevers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Trevor Jon Bevers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Trevor Jon Bevers was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:21 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, DA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY: Nicholas R White, DF: Trevor Jon Bevers appeared from jail.  Includes 22CF181 & 22CM32.  Court reviews files.  DA Anderson recites joint agreement.  Court reviews and reads victim impact statement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads G to Ct 2- Disorderly Conduct WITHOUT Repeater in 22CF181 & G to Ct 1- Disorderly Conduct in 22CM32.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 22CF181 & Ct 1 in 22CM32.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 22CF181.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 2 WITHOUT REPEATER in 22CF181  
  
- Court Costs: $243.00
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
- To be converted to civil judgment

- 45 days jail.  Concurrent to Ct 1 in 22CM32 and Prison Sentence

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CM32

- Court Costs: $243.00
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
- To be converted to civil judgment

- 45 days jail.  Concurrent to Ct 2 in 22CF181 and Prison Sentence

for Release/ Modification/ Change in Sentence. Filed by DE. arc     SRN will address at 06/08/22 hearing. arc
Status conference on June 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

- AMENDED

- Includes 22CF181 and 22CM32 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 
 
-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.R.B and T.B. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Defendant to be remanded to Dodge Correctional Institute

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:36 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, DA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY: Nicholas R White, DF: Trevor Jon Bevers appeared from jail.  Includes 19CF161 (SEHR), 22CF181 & 22CM32- PTC. Court reviews files.  DA Anderson recites requested sentencing.  Atty White makes argument. Court will reserve on credit for time served.  Parties to see JA for scheduling on 22CF181 & 22CM32.  Court amends bond to SIBS, DE remanded to Dodge Correctional Institute. 

Court Orders: Ct 1- OWI 4th in 19CF161
T/S: 5 Years, 0 Months; 2 years I/C, 3 years E/S

DE is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program to serve not less than 2 years of Initial confinement prior to eligibility. 

Conditions of E/S: 

- AODA and follow through
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random and regular testing
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- DE to complete MRT
- Financial obligations to be collected during supervision

Court Orders: Ct 3- Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid in 19CF161

T/S: 3 Years, 1 Month; 1 year, 1 month I/C, 2 years E/S

10:10 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, DA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY: Nicholas R White, DF: Trevor Jon Bevers appeared from jail.  Includes 22CF181 & 22CM32.  Court reviews files. DA Anderson states they are not resolved at this time and part of the reason is because DE is being revoked on probation, DA asking to have this set out to after revocation hearing.  Court questions DE regarding Atty appointment, DE to contact PD's office to see if he now qualifies.  Court will set for short turn around in hopes revocation packet will be filed by DOC soon.  Clerk to look up cases DE is on probation and contact DOC to see when revocation packet will be filed. Adjourned 10:15 AM. bph  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Filed by DA Anderson. arc

Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:29 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, DA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY:  Nicholas R White, DF: Trevor Jon Bevers appeared from jail. Includes 22CF181(PH) & 22CM32 (STC). Court reviews files.  Atty White states they are waiving the prelim. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court continues to ARGN. DA Anderson states information will mirror complaint. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG for all counts.  Waives speedy trial.  Discovery to be sent to defense within 10 days, motions to be filed 10 days after receipt of discovery.  Adjourned 10:39 AM. bph  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
From JA to DE and Atty White. Appointing Counsel. Repayment rate of $50.00 per month 30 day after release from custody. arc
Filed by Atty White. km

Includes 22CF181 and 22CM32 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.  

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.R.B and T.B. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may obtain belongings with a one time visit with law enforcement. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
